snippet: The United Nations secretary general, Ban Ki-moon, called on the Security Council to authorize a peacekeeping force of 12,000 to try to halt sectarian violence in the Central African Republic.
abstract: United Nations Sec Gen Ban Ki-moon arrives in the Central African Republic in an effort to drum up world support for an effort to stanch the widening sectarian conflict there; calls on Security Council to authorize a peacekeeping force of 12,000 to end violence.
lead_paragraph: The United Nations secretary general, Ban Ki-moon, called on the Security Council to authorize a peacekeeping force of 12,000 to try to halt sectarian violence in the Central African Republic.

headline.main: U.N. Leader Urges Action in Central African Republic
headline.print_headline: U.N. Leader Urges Action in Africa Clash
